entry.title: Tootsie Rolls are a Blast from the Past
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
Tootsie Rolls-Candy of the Day

National Candy Month: June 30, 2017

Last Day of National Candy Month 2017

Sadly, it's the last day of June. That means it's the end of National Candy Month. Thank you for following us on our delicious Candy Loving journey! We hope that you've been inspired to eat more candy, and maybe you've even learned some new and interesting candy facts. I know I did, it's been sweet! About to get even sweeter as I unwrap my Tootsie Rolls...

The Original Penny Candy

This old fashion candy all started with a very poor Austrian immigrant,a recipe for delicious candy, and of course a sweet dream! Tootsie Rolls were invented by Leo Hirschfeld. He must have got his sweet determination from his father who was also a  candy maker back home in Austria. Leo first sold Tootsie Rolls in his little shop in New York in 1896. He wrapped each candy by hand. The Tootsie Roll candy is said to be the very first penny candy that was ever sold! Over the years Tootsie Rolls gained immense popularity, and in 1917 Tootsie Rolls were in huge demand. Tootsie Roll Industries has grown to be a huge candy empire and now produces some of our favourite candy brands including: Charms, Charleston Chew, Nik-L-Nip, Wack-O-Wax, Dubble Bubble, Sugar Daddy, Razzles, Junior Mints, Cry Baby and so many more!

Tootsie Rolls named after a Sweetie

I have always wondered about the name and finally learned where it came from. Apparently, Leo Hirschfeld had a sweet little daughter named Clara. It is said that his nick name for Clara was Tootsie, so Leo decided to name the Tootsie Roll candy after his daughter.

Summer Candy that won't melt in the sun

Tootsie Rolls were thought of as being a great alternative to chocolate and they wouldn't melt in the sun, making them a good choice in hotter weather. Soldiers were given Tootsie Rolls in their rations making it easy for them to enjoy as they would not spoil. They were also a  quick pick me up for the soldiers. Tootsie Rolls were even an affordable candy during the Depression. The ingredients were not rationed and they were very inexpensive, so everyone could enjoy them.

Everyone Loves Tootsie Rolls!

To this day Tootsie Rolls are a favorite of many candy lovers! There are over 64 million made everyday! Tootsie Rolls remain a staple in the candy world to this day. They are an old fashion candy that never goes out of style!

entry.title: NECCO Wafers-America's Iconic Candy
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
NECCO Wafers-Candy of the Day

National Candy Month: June 29, 2017

 NECCO Wafers are Old Fashioned Candy from 1847

A sweet and classic old fashioned candy and delightfully delicious. A pack of NECCO Wafers are a perfect companion during National Candy Month. Easy to keep in your pocket and share with your best friend on a nice breezy summer's eve walk. NECCO Wafers have been around since 1847. They were invented by Oliver Chase, who also came up with a special machine that could cut candy into lozenge like shapes. The wafers used to be called "hub wafers" before they were NECCO Wafers. It wasn't until 1901 that they became known as NECCO Wafers. NECCO stands for New England Confectionery Company and is the oldest candy company in the USA!

Soldiers wanted their NECCO Wafers!

During World War two soldiers were given Necco Wafers for their rations, and NECCO says that this greatly increased the popularity of the candy. When all the soldiers returned home they wanted their Necco Wafers!

Candy Lovers wanted the original NECCO Wafers

The original flavours in NECCO Wafers are Lemon, Lime, Orange, Clove, Cinnamon, Wintergreen, Licorice and Chocolate. This was all fine and dandy for the fans of NECCO Wafers until in 2009. NECCO decided to change the flavours into all natural colours and flavours. This proved to be a  complete fail for NECCO! Sales plummeted and in 2011, much to the relief of NECCO Wafer fans, the company went back to the original flavours! 

NECCO Wafers are an old fashion candy, sweet and tasty, perfect for sharing!

Other iconic candies that NECCO makes are Sky Bar, Haviland Thin Mints, Slap Stix, Mary Jane, Mighty Malts, Clark Bar, Candy Buttons, Squirrel Nut Zippers and the awful Sweethearts!

National Candy Day: June 28, 2017

Chocolate and a toy! You guessed it, KInder Surprise Eggs! A favorite and fun choice for many candy lovers, young and old alike. Kinder Surprise come in the shape of an egg. Over 30 Billion Kinder Surprise Eggs!

Kinder Surprise are enjoyed by everyone

KInder Surprise are an Italian invention, thought of by William Salice, and made by the Ferrero Company. Nostalgic Candy Since 1979

Make a cute and sweet summer fashion statement with a delicious Ring Pop! A wearable, retro candy for any one who really knows how to accessorize! Ring Pop first came out in 1979 and we've been eating them, enjoying them and wearing them ever since! 

Ring Pop was invented by a Sweet Candy Engineer

Ring Pop were invented by an engineer who worked for Topps, Frank Richards. Mr. Richards daughter had a terrible habit of sucking her thumb. He was determined to make her stop and tried many things before he came up with the sweet, brilliant idea of candy on a ring, Ring Pop! His idea worked,and his daughter apparently stopped sucking on her thumb. Frank probably saved a lot of money on braces! In any case the world loved his interesting, tasty candy!

Add Bling or Pop the Question with a Ring Pop

"Pop" any summer outfit, or "Pop" the sweet question, with this candy jewel! Ring Pop are a popular retro candy to this day, they certainly are one of a kind, and have sweetly adorned many hands!

Ring Pop come in many Sweet Flavours!

Razzles-Candy of the Day

National Candy Month: June 26, 2017

If your the type who can't quite make up your mind, we've got just the dual purpose candy for you! Razzles! This retro candy first appeared in 1966, and as the slogan says "First it's a candy, then it's a gum. Little round Razzles are so much fun". Yes they are, Razzles are an intense, tangy and sweet candy that magically transforms into gum! Razzles are currently being made right here in Canada by Concord Confections which has been owned by the sweet geniuses at Tootsie Roll Industries since 2004.

Razzles has a cool Retro Candy name

Razzles first got their name due to the fact that they were going to be an exclusively raspberry flavored candy/gum. The name for this raspberry flavor was going to be "razzleberry" but the makers decided to use the real word raspberry instead, and played with the" razzleberry" word in their name. Hence the cool and funky name, Razzles!  For a few years Razzles were only available in raspberry flavoUrs, until they decided to expand into their other delicious fruity flavors.

Razzles are a fun retro candy experience

The fact that these candies change into gum lets you experience a wide range of flavors and texture, which always earns extra points for a candy, especially if it works and tastes great, like Razzles do! How could any candy lover not appreciate this dual purpose candy? Razzles really are transformationial, and such a tasty treat! These little pretty candies, pack a punch with their tangy and sweet flavors.

4 Sweet and Sour Flavours

Razzles come in Razzles Original, Tropical Razzles, Sour Razzles and the latest flavour, Razzles Fizzles. Razzles are the perfect retro candy for any summer day!

A childhood memory, a sweet bite of nostalgia on a stick, BB Bats are an essential old fashion candy for any candy lover! BB Bats were first introduced in 1924, in Johnson City, NY and are currently being made by the Runk Candy Company in Cincinnati Ohio. These Taffy Suckers come in all the best flavours: Vanilla, Strawberry, Chocolate and Banana.

Fall in Love Again with BB Bats Taffy Suckers

Why are they called BB Bats?

Many people have wondered why they are called BB Bats, and I must confess upon hours of research I could not find any real explanation as to why these go by the name of BB Bats. My only conclusion is that perhaps they were enjoyed during all those fun Summer Baseball games, while you watched your friends play, or sat watching the game while enjoying your BB Bat. To say they were made to resemble a baseball bat, would be a far stretch, other then the fact that they are on a stick.

What ever the reason, we'll just have to ponder this question while eating copious amounts of this old fashion candy, BB Bats!

Hubba Bubba Bubble Gum-Candy of the Day 

National Candy Month: June 24, 2017

Bubble Gum is Summertime Fun!

Hubba Bubba is just the gum for those intense bubbles, not too sticky and a very long lasting flavour. Hubba Bubba is a cool retro gum that we've been chewing since 1979. 
"Big bubbles, no troubles"! Hubba Bubba is a  gum that has always captivated us bubble blowers! Hubba Bubba delivers on this promise, the biggest bubbles I've ever blown were from this mouthwatering, delicious Hubba Bubba!

Hubba Bubba is Famous Around the World

Hubba Bubba Bubbble Gum is a very well recognized brand across the world, especially popular in Canada, Australia, Germany and the UK. There is some debate over the name Hubba Bubba. They say that soldiers from World War Two used the term "Hubba Hubba" to express approval. Another theory is that the word comes from the German word "Hubsche'', which translated into English means beautiful. I would assume that the word Bubba is meant to refer to bubbles. So maybe the gum really means Beautiful Bubbles! Who knows the exact history or meaning of the name, we just know that Hubba Bubba is a cool name and it means delicious, retro bubble gum and has the best potential for blowing huge, enormous bubbles!

Hubba Bubba came back in 2004

Much to the dismay of its fans, in the later years of the 1980s, Hubba Bubba was discontinued with no real explanation as to why. No worries though, Hubba Bubba came back to the world with it's sweet, delicious vengeance in 2004. Also with some brand new flavours.

Hubba Bubba comes in many fun flavours

The most sought after and popular flavour of Hubba Bubba is the Original, but there is also Strawberry Crush, Grape Crush, Strawberry Watermelon, and Sour Blue Raspberry. quite a tasty selection! All of Hubba Bubba's flavours are very long lasting, and will not stick to your face after the huge bubbles you have blown,
pop! No troubles, with this Bubble Gum!

Bonomo Turkish Taffy-Candy of the Day

National Candy Day: June 23, 2017

Some of us smack it, some of us freeze it and crack it. How ever you eat it, Bonomo Turkish Taffy is a very nostalgic old fashion candy! Bonomo Turkish Taffy first came out in 1949, and by the 1960's it had become a number one seller! Candy Lovers from days gone by will delight in this Turkish Taffy!

Bonomo Turkish Taffy is a long lasting Old Fashioned Candy

Many people say that the allure of Bonomo Turkish Taffy is how long the flavour lasts. With other candy snacks, you could wolf them down in 30 seconds flat, but with Bonomo Turkish Taffy, it's a whole different story. To eat a whole delicious bar of Bonomo Turkish taffy it could take you 30 minutes or a good hour, depending on the state of your teeth! Bonomo Turkish Taffy was also marketed as being an interactive 
candy. "Crack It Up" as the label says, is like an invitation to play with your food. A six year old would find this fascinating and a Baby Boomer would fondly remember his childhood.

Bonomo Turkish Taffy is now back, forever!

In 1989, Bonomo Turkish Taffy was discontinued , this was very upsetting for it's fans and in 2003, Bonomo Turkish Taffy set up a website for the return of this Taffy and announced that they were taking advance orders. Finally in 2010, the world became reunited again with it's beloved Bonomo Turlish Taffy! What other retro candy could come back from the dead like that?

Sweet Summertime Flavours

Bonomo Turkish Taffy comes in four flavours, Vanilla, Strawberry, Chocolate and Banana, all the most.perfect summer flavours!

Salt Water Taffy-Candy of the Day

National Candy Month-June 21, 2017

Yes, by far the most perfect summer candy! Most fitting for our National Candy Month list! What old fashioned candy feels more like summer than Salt Water Taffy? The perfect candy to bring on those long summer car rides. Great for enjoying while you're sitting on the beach, or taking a stroll in the sand.

Old Fashioned Candy for 125 Years!

Salt Water Taffy simply takes you back in time. You'll be tasting some of your most nostalgic childhood memories with Taffy Town Salt Water Taffy!

Candy lovers first fell in love with Salt Water Taffy some time ago, early in the 1880's. We've been eating it for over 125 years! Most famous for it's perfectly chewy, stretchy texture. Not to mention the sweet look of this stuff, some of the prettiest shades ever of pastel colours, Well, unless your eating the black licorice flavor! 

Salt Water Taffy has a Stormy Story

Despite Salt Water Taffy's name, there is no salt water in this taffy. It it was originally produced in Atlantic City, New Jersey. David Bradley who ran a candy store had a terrible flood after a huge storm and his entire stock of taffy became drenched. A little girl wandered in and asked him if he had any taffy for sale, he replied "you mean salt water taffy".David's mother heard him say "salt water taffy" and exclaimed to her son that "salt water taffy" was a perfect name for this taffy.The name has certainly stuck and is still one of the most popular, well known old fashion candies today. Taffy Town has some of the best Salt Water Taffy around, soft and chewy morsels of  pure happiness!

Maynards Wine Gums-Candy of the Day

National Candy Month-June 20, 2017


An Old Fashion Candy that's an ideal summer candy! Truly a classic choice for candy lovers. Maynards Wine Gums have been around since 1909 and are made in Toronto. Wine Gums are ideal in their texture. They are chewy but never too sticky or stretchy. Maynards Wine Gums are a sophisticated candy. So very tasty with all their fine and distinctive flavors.

Have a Wine Gum instead of wine

Despite their name, Wine Gums contain no wine in them and were actually meant to persuade people to eat the candy instead of drinking alcoholic beverages. Well, Wine Gums are delightfully delicious and could easily be savored to the likes of a "fine wine'.
The flavors in Maynards Wine Gums are not overly sweet, and they have a certain level of tartness to them, but not sour. The original flavors of Wine Gums include: Raspberry (red) lemon (yellow) orange (orange) lime(green) black current(black) and grapefruit(white).

What your favourite Wine Gum flavour?

Every flavor of Maynards Wine Gums are utterly fantastic. They say the flavor that most people love the best are the black ones, which are the black current flavor. I must admit, they are my favorite Wine Gum flavor! Maynards Wine Gums seem to pull you in with their smooth and intense fruity flavors. They do have an addictive quality to them. One roll is never enough, but to be honest neither is one bag!

Sour Wine Gums

Maynards Candy also have a sour version of Wine Gums that are every bit as tasty as the original Wine Gums but leave you with a more intense tartness and tangy feeling.  Maynards Sour Wine Gums start off on a sour note, but then reel you back in with their usual sweetness
Maynards Wine Gums are a retro candy that seem to acquire more fans everyday. Put down your glass of Cabernet Sauvigon and reach for your Wine Gums instead!
